DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Effectiveness Teen Options Prevent Pregnancy ( T.O.P.P . ) Program
DOC.detailed_description: The risk teen pregnancy especially high among teen mother , lead , case , unsafe interval teen birth . The Teen Options Prevent Pregnancy ( T.O.P.P . ) program 18-month clinic-based program aim reduce repeat pregnancy among pregnant parent adolescent provide telephone-based care coordination mobile contraceptive service high-risk population . This study use randomize controlled design compare effectiveness T.O.P.P . versus usual care provide patient participate clinic . Study participant adolescent mother age 10 19 recruit seven OhioHealth woman 's health clinic three OhioHealth hospital cover seven county central Ohio . This study conduct part national Evaluation Adolescent Pregnancy Prevention Approaches fund U.S. Department Health Human Services ' Office Adolescent Health .
